ratings.comment: Professor Wu is my favorite finance professor. The course material is difficult, but he takes time to explain it and makes sure that everyone understands what's going on. He demonstrates care for his students and is a really kind, approachable individual. Definitely show up to class and take good notes to do well, but highly recommend him!

Professor Youchang is a very intelligent professor who broke down complex concepts into simpler ways to think, making them easier to understand. I would take this professor for any Finance 462/562 class requirement. He cares about the material and how his students learn. He also incorporates real-world situations and news into his class material.

One of my favorite teachers he teaches at UO now and is a good teacher that wants you to succeed. Class is challenging, but can be done if you pay attention and do the homework. Tests are very straight forward with no surprises and curves the entire class. Gave points back on the midterm and extra credit opportunities throughout the term.

Overall a good professor. He does move fairly fast but takes time to explain it if someone doesn't understand something. Textbook is optional but I would suggest getting it if you need extra practice questions. You are allowed a note sheet for the midterm and final. There is a short quiz every class for attendance that he may or may not go over.

Professor Wu is one of the best finance teachers I have had at the University of Oregon. He takes an extremely complex subject and makes it very manageable. He is also always available for office hours, so if you get lost just shoot him an email and he will be happy to help.

462 is a difficult class but Youchang Wu does a great job being there for his students and if you apply yourself you will gain a lot from this class. He curves to the highest possible grade that the university will allow so a lot of these comments about "kissing your gpa goodbye" is simply not true. Wu is a great professor.
Very caring and reasonable. One of the best and most applicable finance classes I have taken at the University of Oregon.

He is a really kind, knowledgeable, and great overall professor! This class can definitely be challenging, so you need to pay attention in class and do the homework. He also does a great job at tying in real world examples and making you feel like your college degree has some sort of application into the real world.

This course was not easy, but the professor made sure that students had enough material to be ready for exams. There are in class quizzes and review quizzes due after every class, but they're very straightforward and should help boost your grade. Overall, he was a great professor and made the class as interesting as derivatives can be.

Professor Wu is really great and the reviews on here are just not true. He is so caring and wants you to do well. Just pay attention in class and do the review questions, you will do well on the midterm and final. I really enjoyed this class, sometimes the lectures do get long, but that comes with the topic. If you can, take finance with him at UO!
This class was great. Definitely have to go to class, but everything is very manageable. He is very accommodating and we always help his students succeed.
He is fantastic professor and really cared about his students. This is a difficult topic but he factors that in and is very reasonable.
This is the class that makes frat bros realize this finance is the wolf of wallstreet. Youchang is the goat of derivatives

This was, by far, the worst class I've taken. I go to the University of Oregon, but but he is beyond difficult to follow and his exams will destroy you. While attendance isn't "mandatory," you can kiss your GPA goodbye if you take his class. Even the homework is beyond difficult, and the man literally gets lost while teaching his OWN examples!

Knowledeable professional and nice person Mr Wu lacks teaching skills. He does not break down complicated concepts and goes over them rather quickly. Though willing to help he is not good at explaining things. You can do well in his class if you grind the book, but you will have to read a lot over a short period of time.
He's getting this score since he is such a dick. His office hours are useless since he will just tell you to go back to lecture slides.

He's a great professor and wants the student to succeed. Very accessible if you have any questions or concerns and is always willing to help. Sucks that most people stop showing up after the first midterm even though he is a very nice teacher and wants to teach you. Exams are heavily based on the quizzes so make sure you understand those questions.

Nice person but lack of teaching ability. He sure knows the material well enough, but his explanation were always poorly organized. He always tends to break down the knowledge into small pieces and help you understand better, but it turns out more confusing. After the midterm, only half of the class comes, and people leave occasionally

Prof Wu doesn't like to answer questions during his office hour. His office hour is a torture, because he would let you go back and read the book. He is the worst finance professor I have ever had. He went everything super fast and didn't make any sense. His lecture slides are pretty close to trash.

You can tell Prof Wu really cares about helping students truly understanding the material and is very enthusiastic about teaching in general. There are two midterms and a final (not too difficult), group work throughout the semester, and an easy (5 minute) group presentation.
He is the best professor I met in UW-Madison. His lectures are well organized and he mades every knowledge point crystal clear. I learned a lot from the course and exercises.

The professor is very interested in this course for sure but he seems to have the ability to make interesting materials rather dry. Not many students attend the lectures and I have a hard time not to fall asleep during the lecture. Problems sets are OK and you can work in groups and get same scores. Only one midterm and one final.

330 is a hard class in general--Professor Wu is a great teacher and great person who is willing to help students. Midterm was predictable and final a little bit harder. Gives quizzes to make sure students keep up with work. Overall a good class.

Professor Wu is very clear when teaching derivatives. It's the class that you need to have clear notes for, clear teaching methods, and fairly predictable exams...and Professor Wu goes above that. Four quizzes and four problem sets throughout the semester make sure you don't fall behind. Exams are semi-difficult, but predictable. Wu is the best.
